title: Relates to the educational preparation for practice of professional nursing
summary: Requires registered professional nurses to attain a baccalaureate degree in nursing within ten years of their initial licensure; provides exemptions for those currently licensed or enrolled in nursing programs.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to the educational prepa-
         ration for practice of professional nursing

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The legislature hereby finds and  declares  that  with  the
    2  increasing  complexity  of  the  American  healthcare system and rapidly
    3  expanding technology, the  educational  preparation  of  the  registered
    4  professional  nurse  must  be  expanded. The nurse of the future must be
    5  prepared to partner with multiple  disciplines  as  a  collaborator  and
    6  manager  of  the complex patient care journey. Shorter lengths of stays,
    7  higher patient acuity, and more sophisticated  technologies  and  proce-
    8  dures  are  increasing  the  complexity  of patient care - which in turn
    9  places great  demands  on  nursing  competencies.  Other  countries  are
   10  responding  to these changes by requiring the baccalaureate degree as an
   11  entry requirement for nursing  licensure  while  other  professions  are
   12  demanding  master  and  doctoral  degrees  as their entry point. Several
   13  recent research studies clearly demonstrate the  added  value  of  addi-
   14  tional  education  in  relation  to improved patient outcomes; one study
   15  demonstrates that each ten percent increase in the number  of  baccalau-
   16  reate  prepared  nurses  results  in a five percent decrease in surgical
   17  patient deaths. Therefore, the  legislature  finds  that  expanding  the
   18  educational  requirements for the profession of nursing, while maintain-

    1  ing the multiple entry points into the profession, is needed.  This bill
    2  affects future nurses graduating from associate degree or diploma  nurs-
    3  ing  programs who would be required to obtain a baccalaureate in nursing
    4  within  ten  years  of initial licensure. All current nurses licensed in
    5  New York and students in programs preparing for registered  professional
    6  nursing  are  to be exempt from the new requirement. This legislation is
    7  mirrored after the progressive education requirement for teachers in New
    8  York state. Numerous regulatory and accrediting bodies have  recommended
    9  this  change  as  a  means  to  address sophisticated patient care needs
   10  resulting from shorter lengths of stay, higher acuity and more sophisti-
   11  cated interventions. This proposal is the result of a  growing  body  of
   12  research  evidence  that  additional education results in better patient
   13  outcomes. Therefore by requiring the baccalaureate degree for  continued
   14  registration  as  a  registered professional nurse this bill seeks to be
   15  responsive to meet the increasingly complex health  care  needs  of  the
   16  residents of New York state.
   17    S 2. Subdivision 2 of section 6905 of the education law, as amended by
   18  chapter  994 of the laws of 1971 and such section as renumbered by chap-
   19  ter 50 of the laws of 1972, is amended to read as follows:
   20    (2) Education: have received an education, and a diploma or degree  in
   21  professional nursing, in accordance with the commissioner's regulations,
   22  AND  IN  ORDER  TO  CONTINUE  TO  MAINTAIN  REGISTRATION AS A REGISTERED
   23  PROFESSIONAL NURSE IN NEW YORK  STATE,  HAVE  ATTAINED  A  BACCALAUREATE
   24  DEGREE  IN  NURSING  WITHIN TEN YEARS OF INITIAL LICENSURE IN ACCORDANCE
   25  WITH THE COMMISSIONER'S REGULATIONS. IN ITS DISCRETION,  THE  DEPARTMENT
   26  MAY ISSUE A CONDITIONAL REGISTRATION TO A LICENSEE WHO FAILS TO COMPLETE
   27  THE  BACCALAUREATE DEGREE BUT WHO AGREES TO MEET THE ADDITIONAL REQUIRE-
   28  MENT WITHIN ONE YEAR. THE FEE FOR SUCH A CONDITIONAL REGISTRATION  SHALL
   29  BE  THE SAME AS, AND IN ADDITION TO, THE FEE FOR THE TRIENNIAL REGISTRA-
   30  TION. THE DURATION OF SUCH CONDITIONAL REGISTRATION  SHALL  BE  FOR  ONE
   31  YEAR  AND  MAY  BE EXTENDED, WITH THE PAYMENT OF A FEE, FOR NO MORE THAN
   32  ONE ADDITIONAL YEAR. ANY LICENSEE WHO IS NOTIFIED OF  THE  DENIAL  OF  A
   33  REGISTRATION FOR FAILURE TO COMPLETE THE ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONAL REQUIRE-
   34  MENTS  AND WHO PRACTICES AS A REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE WITHOUT SUCH
   35  REGISTRATION MAY BE SUBJECT  TO  DISCIPLINARY  PROCEEDINGS  PURSUANT  TO
   36  SECTION SIXTY-FIVE HUNDRED TEN OF THIS TITLE;
   37    S 3. The provisions of this act shall not apply to:
   38    a.  any  student  entering  a  generic baccalaureate program preparing
   39  registered professional nurses after the effective date of this act;
   40    b. any student currently enrolled in, or having an application pending
   41  in, a program preparing registered nurses as of the  effective  date  of
   42  this act;
   43    c.  any  person already licensed as a registered professional nurse or
   44  any unlicensed graduate professional nurse who is eligible to  take  the
   45  National  Council Licensure Examination as of the effective date of this
   46  act.
   47    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately and  the  commissioner  of
   48  education  is  authorized to promulgate any rule or regulation necessary
   49  to implement the provisions of this act.
